snippet: Nineteen chains reported a 0.8 percent increase in sales at stores open at least a year on average, missing the 1.5 percent gain that analysts forecasted.
abstract: Thomson Reuters reports sales at stores open at least a year at major retail chains rose 0.8 percent in April, compared with April 2011; sales missed the 1.5 percent gain that analysts forecasted.
